metadata.title: DPM/FM Dar chairs preparatory committee meeting on girlsÃ¢ÂÂ education in Muslim communities

content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, Jan 01 (APP): Deputy Prime Minister/ Foreign Minister Senator Mohammad Ishaq Dar on Wednesday chaired a meeting of the preparatory committee for the international conference on aGirlsa education in Muslim communities: challenges and opportunities,a to be hosted by Pakistan from 11a12 January. The meeting was attended by the Minister Youth Affairs Rana Mashood Ahmad Khan, Secretary Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Secretary Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, Chairman CDA, and other senior officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Ministry of Federal Education and Professional Training, Foreign Office Spokesperson said in a press release. The committee reviewed the preparations for the conference, which would feature a comprehensive agenda, including discussions on barriers to girlsa education; the social and economic benefits of girlsa education; and innovative approaches to advancing education equity.
content.summary: Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Senator Mohammad Ishaq Dar chaired a preparatory committee meeting for an international conference on girls' education in Muslim communities. The conference, to be hosted by Pakistan in January, will address challenges, opportunities, and innovative approaches to advancing education equity.

entities.text: Ministry of Federal Education and Professional Training
